Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a voluted nozzle, decorated on the discus with a man breaking in a horse. The lamp stands on a raised base. Overfired yellow-brown clay covered with a purple-brown slip.
Curator's comments: Not first generation: the lamp was used as an archetype (note filling-hole and air-hole marks).
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1894)
Bailey 1972 / Greek and Roman Pottery Lamps (pl.7d)
